page.title: 03BRICKENDON CHAPEL
page.content: The Chapel was built in 1931/32 and consecrated in 1933.It was designed to simulate a converted timber barn,in keeping with the surroundings.The dedication is to "The Holy Cross and St.Alban",the former because Brickendon Manor used to belong to the Abbey of Waltham (Waltham Holy Cross) and the latter from the Patron Saint of the diocese.The vicar and curates are shared with the neighbouring churches of Bayford and Essendon and the present vicar's wife is a Deaconess.A prominent feature of the grounds of the Chapel is a Great Cross of oak,designed by Alexander Nairne, erected in 1931. Evensong is the most popular service each Sunday.
